alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 12:12AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Randolph County through 1230 AM CST... At 1212 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Roanoke, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke, Big Springs, Paran and Rock Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Birmingham. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for east central Alabama.
